dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (voice over) ...That is, whenever I could find one.

direction.raw_text: (voice over) He had his foot in the door and he kept right on pushing to get in. He had lost the election but he had won the state... and he knew it... and the people knew it.

dialogue.raw_text: (voice over) Willie was right -- he'd learned how to win...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (voice over) He spent a lot of money doing it... an awful lot of money... I was beginning to wonder where he got it from.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (voice over) There were rumors throughout the state that Willie was making deals with all kinds of people... strange deals... for Willie Stark.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (voice over) The second time out, it wasn't a campaign... it was a slaughter. It was Saturday night in a mining town.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (voice over) He came back and he took me with him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is Jack Burden, a friend of mine. From now on he's going to live here. Give him anything he wants.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let these boys through, officer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Jack) Duffy works for me now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It looks like everybody works for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. No, not yet. But I want to keep him around. He reminds me of something I never want to forget.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Duffy) Come on, come on, come on, come on. Are these the boys?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: These are the boys that can get the boys.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How many do you think we can get?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fifty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How much?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Five dollars a head.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Sugar Boy) What do you think, Sugar? Do they look like good boys?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: T-t-they b-b-better be.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get a hundred... All right, go on, all of you. Blow. Blow, blow. You too, Duffy. Go on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Jack) Handbill distributors.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If they all look like them I'd hate not to take one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's the object. Not like when they beat up my boy Tom.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How is Tom?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, he's fine. He starts college in the fall.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh. And Lucy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fine... fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, I need a boy... Where's a boy? (boy runs up) Take that downstairs; they're waiting for it. Right away, on the double. (to typist) Listen, baby, you've got to double- space all of this... he can't read, see.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sadie!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to typist) And they need four copies. (looks up) Hi, Jack. How are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sadie is my secretary now. (to messenger, trying to squeeze by) Oh, pardon me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fix your tie, Willie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Sugar.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Keep everybody out of here. I want to talk to Jack and Sadie alone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: From now on you're working for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Doing what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know. Something will turn up, won't it, Sadie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. We need a college man around... for research.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How much did they pay you on that newspaper?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Three hundred dollars a month.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (laughs) I could buy you cheap, couldn't I?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For a bag of salt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. No, I don't play that way. I like you, boy. I always have. I'll tell you what I'll do. I'll give you four hundred dollars a month and traveling expenses.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You throw money around like it was money.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Money?... I don't need money. People give me things.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because they believe in me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (voice over) I was going home again. But this time it was different. Now I had a feeling that maybe the waiting was over... for me, and for Anne.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a far cry from where I come from... to this house.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And standing here under the portrait of one of the greatest governors of this state, talking to you people... well, it's an honor I never thought I'd have.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are there any questions? (looks around) Mr. McEvoy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiles) No, I have no questions.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Judge?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A few... but it will hold.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have a question.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shoot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A lot of people in this state have been saying that you've been making deals... some of them with the very groups that you claim you're against. Is that true?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Adam, you know how rumors start...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. Yes, that's true. I have nothing to hide. I'll make a deal with the devil if it'll help me carry out my program. But believe me, there are no strings attached to those deals.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're sure about that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Doc, Jack here has been telling me how you feel about things... how you'd like to see a new hospital built, a hospital that's the biggest and best that money can buy. You want those things, Doc, because, well, because you're a man who wants to do good. Now, I'd like to ask you a question.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shoot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you know what good comes out of?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You tell me, Mr. Stark.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Out of bad... that's what good comes out of. Because you can't make it out of anything else. You didn't know that, did you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I didn't... There's another question I'd like to ask you. You say there's only bad to start with and the good must come with the bad. Who's to determine what's good and what's bad?... You?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why not?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why, that's easy. Just... just make it up as you go along.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Folks, there's a time to talk and there's a time to act. I think the time to act is right now. And with your support, I not only will win but I will do all of the things I promised. I need your help. Oh, I need it badly. But I'm not going to beg for it. In the name of this state which we love... in the name of the governor in whose house we meet... I demand it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Judge) Well, what do you say, sir?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You've got to say yes. With you in the race...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm an old bird... I...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But a game one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, I'll give you complete power as attorney general. You can do anything you see fit. I'll swing the ax to clear the way for you. Is that a deal?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a deal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jack, we have to get back to town... a lot to do. (shakes hands with Adam) Dr. Stanton.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm very glad to have met you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We want Willie! We want Willie!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (raises his hands for silence) This is not a time for speechmaking. I should get on my knees and ask God to give me strength to carry out your will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This much I swear to you. These things you shall have. I'm going to build a hospital. The biggest that money can buy... and it will belong to you. That any man, woman, or child who is sick or in pain can go through those doors and know that everything will be done for them that man can do. To heal sickness. To ease pain. Free. Not as a charity, but as a right. And it is your right that every child shall have a complete education. That any man who produces anything can take it to market without paying toll. And no poor man's land or farm can be taxed or taken away from him. And it is the right of the people that they will not be deprived of hope...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Does he mean it, Jack? Does he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (as he walks away) That's his bribe.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (voice over) What if it was his bribe! He swept the old gang out of office. What if they hollered like stuck pigs? He jammed through bill after bill and the people got what they wanted.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I demand that this bill be passed. Nobody's going to tell me how to run this state.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (voice over) He started to build the roads, the schools, the power dams, to change the face of the state from one end to the other... His methods?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (voice over) Politics is a dirty game... and he played it rough and dirty. Willie's little black book was a record of sin and corruption. And me, Jack Burden? I kept the book and added up the accounts.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (voice over) Clown, show-off, playboy, they yelled at him. Building football stadiums. Fiercely proud of his son who played in them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, look at him go. He's going to be All-American.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (voice over) They said he was building up a private army. But he was building, always building...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (voice over) Always playing up to the crowd. Letting them trample on tradition. Well, tradition needed trampling on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (voice over) The crowd loved it... Willie loved it... and so did I.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (through open door) You low-down, no-good redneck...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to secretary) What goes on here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what Sadie wants to know. (she shows Jack newspaper containing photograph of Willie at the nightclub) The boss poses for too many pictures.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll kill him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why, Sadie, I'm surprised at you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll kill him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hate all women.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Was she pretty?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Was she pretty?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If I met her on the street I'd never recognize her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Was she pretty?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How should I know? I wasn't looking at her face... Look, if it's going to cause all this grief, why don't you let him go?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let him go? I'll kill him. I'll drive him out of this state.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just because a guy's sitting with a couple of girls on his knees in public...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Public or private... I know him. How about what happened in Chicago? That girl on skates... and the time you both went to St. Louis... There's a new invention, you know, Photography and newsreels. Willie Stark in a nightclub... Willie Stark with a blonde.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You could always bleach your hair.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I could also break every bone in his neck. After all I've done for him... Now he goes two-timing me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's been two-timing Lucy. So there's another kind of arithmetic for what he's doing to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lucy? (laughs) If she had her way he'd be back in Kanoma City slopping the hogs right now. And he knows it. He knows what she'd do for him. She had her chance.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You seem to think Lucy's on her way out, don't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He'll ditch her... Give him time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You ought to know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, you got the wrong guy. I'm not the hero of this piece.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, come on, both of you. Let's go, hurry it up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on. Pillsbury put his hand in the pork barrel and got caught. You know, I never did trust that guy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have you heard about Pillsbury? What do you intend to do about Pillsbury? How about it, Governor?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Later, boys, later. (to Jack) Say, Jack, go back and get the Judge. Let's get him over to my hotel just as soon as you can.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Willie) I waited for you. (she sees Sadie) Hello. (back to Willie) You promised we could... uh... discuss my charity project... Children's home?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I'm very sorry. Something very important came up. You'll call me later, won't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, certainly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're late.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look at you, Pillsbury. Fifty years old, gut-sprung, teeth gone, never had a dime. If the Almighty had intended for you to be rich he'd have taken care of that a long time ago. The idea of you being rich... that's plain blasphemy. Ain't that a fact?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Answer me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Louder, man. Don't mumble. Speak up. Say it's a fact, a blasphemous fact.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a fact, a blasphemous fact.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah?... Oh, I see. (hangs up) Dumond can't come. He says his wife is sick.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't care if she's dying. Sugar, get the car. Get him and bring him over here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now, you know what you're supposed to do, don't you, Pillsbury? You're supposed to stay poor and take orders. Oh, there'll be some sweetening for you from time to time... but Duffy'll take care of that. Don't you go setting yourself up on your own again, do you understand that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Louder, man. And say, I understand that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I understand that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Give him a pen and some paper, Sadie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: See who that is, Duffy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, hello, Judge. Sit down. I'll be with you in just a couple of seconds. (back to Pillsbury) Now write what I tell you to write... Dear Governor Stark. I wish to resign as auditor due to ill health, to take effect as soon as you can relieve me. Respectfully yours. (after a pause) Did you sign it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (roaring) Well, sign it! Don't put any date on it. I can fill that in when I need it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now bring it to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now get out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The papers have the story.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, I know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're talking about impeachment proceedings.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rising) Against who?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This time, Pillsbury.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got that "this time," Judge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How true is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's too true.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes? (hands phone to Willie) This is it, Willie. Jeff Hopkins on the wire.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What have we got on Hopkins, Jack? (as Jack riffles through the black book) Hello, Jeff. About that Pillsbury business... (reads from black book Jack holds out for him) Here's what I want you to do when it comes up in the legislature. Now, wait a minute, wait a minute. You listen to me. (still reading from book) You got a mortgage coming due on that place of yours in about five weeks, haven't you? You'd like to get it renewed, wouldn't you? (pause) All right, Tiny'll talk to you in the morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get going, Tiny.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You haven't answered my question. Why are you saving Pillsbury's hide?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not a bit interested in Pillsbury's hide. It's something much more important than that. If the McMurphy boys get the notion they can get away with this, there's no telling where they'll stop.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) Or where you will... Pillsbury is guilty. As attorney general of this state, it's my job to prosecute.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Judge, you talk like Pillsbury was... was human. He isn't. He's a thing. You don't prosecute an adding machine if the spring goes busted and makes a mistake. You fix it. Well, I fixed him. I'm not a bit interested in Pillsbury. It's something much bigger than that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (getting up) Yes, it is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's right, Judge. Can't you see that he's right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's right because you want him to be right. Because you're afraid to admit you've made a mistake. Do it now before it's too late. (to Willie) I'm offering my resignation as attorney general. You'll have it in writing by messenger in the morning... dated.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) It took you a long time to make up your mind, Judge. A long time. What made you take such a long time?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wasn't sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And now you are?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll tell you what you are. You're scared. You sat in that big easy chair of yours for thirty years and played at being a judge. Then all of a sudden I came along and put a bat in your hand, and I said, go ahead, Judge, start swinging. And you did. And you had a wonderful time. But now you're scared. You don't want to get your hands dirty. You want to pick up the marbles... but you don't want to get your hands dirty. Look at my whole program, Judge. How do you think I put that across?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I knew how, but I never knew why.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're not by any chance thinking of going over to McMurphy's boys, are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm through with politics.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm happy to hear that. (extends his hand) No hard feelings.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (ignores the hand) Goodbye, Governor. (to Jack) Are you coming with me, Jack?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're making a mistake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you think he means it when he says he's through with politics, Sadie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. No, I don't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What about you, Jack?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've known the Judge all my life. He's always meant everything he's said.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right. All right. Take it easy. I'll take your word for it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sugar, take Miss Stanton home. (to Anne) When am I going to see you again?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the matter, Anne?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please take me home now, Sugar Boy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You've got to understand me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (turns away) I understand you. It's myself I don't understand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you think I like sneaking around corners any more than you do? But right now, with the Pillsbury business and with your uncle quitting... If I got a divorce...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe we'd better stop seeing each other.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. No, we won't stop seeing each other, will we?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (slowly) No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because you believe in what I tell you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (puts her hand on his) Because I believe what you tell me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good evening, Governor Stark. (looks at Anne, but talks to Willie) I thought you might like to know that Judge Stanton kept his promise. (directly to Willie) He gave the story to every paper in town.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sugar, meet me at the hotel as soon as you can.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She walks away from him. Adam enters, carrying bundles of food and two wine bottles.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack watches her through the open bathroom door.

direction.raw_text: The car goes across a bridge, weaving. Two motorcycle cops parked there start to give chase. Tom's car swerves out of control and crashes through a fence. The two motorcycle cops ride out to the field to the wrecked car. They find Tom and Helene, unconscious. One of the cops picks up the empty bottle and hands it to the other.

dialogue.raw_text: If you let Willie Stark get away with the Pillsbury graft, there's no telling...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But we beat the Pillsbury rap... It's over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: These things are never over. I'll tell you what I want you to do, Jack. I want you to start a new page in that black book of yours... under then name of Judge Stanton.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're crazy. There's nothing on the Judge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why? Because his name is Stanton?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ssshhh, easy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What if I won't do it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, some of this has rubbed off on you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you going to do? Have me shot?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No... no... but I'll have to get myself a new boy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I tell you there's nothing on the Judge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jack, there's something on everybody. Man is conceived in sin and born in corruption.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a waste of time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the matter, Jack? Are you afraid you might find something out?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (voice over) I kept saying to myself that Willie was wrong about the Judge. If there was anything left at Burden's Landing, it was honor. I had to believe that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anne, I want to ask you a question. Was the Judge ever broke? Really broke?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why do you want to know?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't want to know, but I've got to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did he tell you -- JACK Did who tell me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know. I... how should I know if the Judge was ever broke?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello... Come on, Anne, take this food and start cooking. I'm hungry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Me, I'm on the thirsty side. Bring some glasses, Anne, quick.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (laughing) It's been a long time since I played this thing. What do you say we wake up the ghosts, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calling to Anne) Another glass, Anne, for a ghost.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (starting to play) Remember the last time I played this? You and Anne were dancing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shall we dance?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's... let's have a drink first.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, no... keep playing. Anne and I want to hear this, don't we, Anne? (Jack pours the wine) Adam... ghost... and me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What shall we drink to?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To the ghost?... To Adam, to the director of the new medical center.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (bangs the piano keys) Don't you ever stop working for him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Adam!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I came up here to get away...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry, Adam.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I'm not. What's wrong with being the director of the new medical center?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing, except that I'm not going to take it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why? Because your uncle resigned?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's partly it. There are other things.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What other things?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looks at her) You too?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, me too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anne, if Adam doesn't want to discuss it, let's not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, let's discuss it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But calmly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Calmly. Go ahead, Jack. Why do you think he wants me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because you're the best man for the job.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It could have nothing to do with my name being Stanton?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It could have. Let's grant that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's your answer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, it's not. If that were the only answer I wouldn't be with him any more. There's another side of it. I've learned something from him. You can't make an omelet without cracking eggs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Or heads.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But at least a hospital will be built, and the sick will be cared for.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At what price?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At any price.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you really believe that, Jack?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I really believe that Stark wants to do good. You do too. It's a matter of method. Many times out of evil comes good. Well, pain is an evil. As a doctor you should know that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pain is an evil; it is not evil. It is not evil in itself. Stark is evil.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The people of the state don't think so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How would they know? The first thing he did was to take over the newspapers and the radio stations. Why be so afraid of criticism? If Stark is interested in doing good, he should also be interested in the truth. I don't see how you can separate the two. No, Stark is not for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (upset) No, Stark is not for you. Well, what is for you? Pride. Pride, that's all it is... foolish, stupid pride. All you've ever talked about is what you could do if... if somebody would tear down and build. All right, all right, somebody has, and he's given it to you. But he's not for you. No, he's not for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anne... Anne...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (voice over) Will I find anything, Judge? Will I? I didn't find it all at once. It takes a long time to go through old courthouse records and musty deeds... a very long time. But it wasn't too hard for me. I was well trained in research, especially this kind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (voice over) I found what I didn't want to find.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have some photostat copies made of these. I'll be back tomorrow for them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's me, Sadie Burke.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait a minute.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, come in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Phew! Awful lot of smoke. Awful lot of whisky. You sober?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll have one with you. (starts tidying up the room) What are you hiding out for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not. I've been sleeping.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For four days? You've been back in town for four days.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Willie knows everything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Willie's worried about his boy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Willie's boy is worried about Willie's boy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, why don't you put something on the phonograph -- a low-down, mean blues. Play it over and over again until you're sick of it. Then crack it and go back to work. (sits down) I do it all the time.

dialogue.raw_text: That's not my problem.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, it isn't your problem. (gets up again) I'll wait for you if you want to powder your nose.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll be with you in a minute.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hmmm. Yeah, I can see it. I've got to look in the mirror to be able to see it. Soft, white skin... not like mine. (runs her hand across her cheeks) I had smallpox when I was a kid. Where I lived it seemed nearly all the kids had smallpox...

dialogue.raw_text: It leaves your face hard. Then she's got poise. Look at the way she holds her head... at just the right angle. That takes training. That takes years of training...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I see what Willie sees. Willie's got big ideas, Jack.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A girl like that could be a governor's wife. Or even a President's.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you talking about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He ditched Lucy, he ditched me, and he'll ditch you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is the way the roads used to be. But there are those who claim that they were adequate for the people's needs, that you don't need a four- or six-lane highway for a horse and buggy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When Stark boasts of his great school system, his critics say: you can't go to school and work in the fields at the same time. And they question the benefit of these projects, charging that the need and the poverty of the people is as great as before.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Willie Stark has never forgotten the source of his power: the people who supported him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: KANOMA CITY, BIRTHPLACE OF WILLIE STARK

dialogue.raw_text: He still keeps in touch with these people of the backwoods, making periodic trips to such places as Kanoma City, now famous as his birthplace...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For those who say that Willie Stark is a man of destiny, there are others who claim that he is a man of evil, a man who cares neither for the people nor the state, but only for his own personal power and ambition.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Obviously, these ambitions go far beyond the boundaries of the state. Just how far, only time will tell. Meanwhile, he is here...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...and from the looks of things, he is here to stay. Willie Stark: messiah or dictator?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How do you like it, Governor?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How many theaters will this play in?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All over the country.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hear that, Jack. All over the country.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, there's one thing in there I didn't like too well. That messiah or dictator.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's our point of view, Governor. And that's the way it stands.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, all right, that's the way it stands... as of now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : STARK FARMHOUSE, DAY Tom and Pappy Stark are seated on the porch. Tom is in a wheelchair. Lucy comes onto the porch as the sound of sirens is heard, and Willie's two cars, motorcycle escort, and the car of reporters turn onto the drive. Tom, upset, flips his cigarette away as the cars stop in front of the porch. Lucy puts her hand on his shoulder to calm him. Then Willie climbs up the steps to greet Lucy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom doesn't answer. Lucy offers her cheek to Willie. Sadie, Jack, and Sugar Boy wait at the bottom of the steps, along with the reporters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He starts arranging the family for the picture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cameras click.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Interior: Stark Farmhouse, Night Willie is finishing his meal, seated at the table with his family and Jack. Sugar Boy stands behind Willie. Sadie has left the table and is examining the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pappy leans over as Willie demonstrates how it works.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns the dial.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pappy laughs delightedly. He reaches out to turn the dial.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom starts to wheel toward Willie, but Lucy restrains him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Willie turns off the radio. There is a silence. Then Willie turns to Lucy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom wheels himself into his own room. Lucy starts to follow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly Willie turns his face away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Willie looks up at Jack and Pappy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack hands him a bottle and he takes a slug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pappy shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

The motorcycle escort leads them away from the farm. DISSOLVE TO: Exterior: Highway, Night As the cars speed to Capital City. Interior: State Legislature, Night There is great excitement in the assembly room. One senator steps forward and addresses the speaker of the house.

direction.raw_text: His resolution is met with a mixture of cheers and boos. Exterior: State Capitol, Night A huge crowd is gathered outside. Pillsbury, Sadie, and Duffy, waiting with the crowd, step forward as they see Willie's car approach. Newsmen take pictures as Willie gets out of the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He starts up the steps of the building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Interior: Willie's Executive Offices, Night
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Willie turns to Jack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Willie turns to go into his private office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Willie shrugs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hello, Lucy... How are you making it, Pa?... How are you, Tom?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I made some refreshments for your friends. I'll get them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll help.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (firmly) No, thank you. Thank you kindly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you don't mind, Mrs. Stark... the boys have to get back to make the morning editions. (to photographers) Set 'em up on the porch, fellows. We'll take some pictures out here, first.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mrs. Stark, please... All right, fellows, take one down there, will you please... Shoot it up this way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (on the last bite) You're still a great cook, Lucy. Great cook. (gets up) Well, I guess I better be getting back to town. Nice to have spent the day with the family. (kisses Lucy on the forehead) Goodbye, Lucy. (extends his hand to Tom) Tom.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (ignores the gesture) Goodbye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Take care of yourself, Pappy. Oh, uh... how do you like the new radio I got you? (walks over to it) You know how it works? You can get police calls on it. Come here, come here... I'll show you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This one for police calls up here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Car sixty-two, proceed to five- eighteen Oak Street. Tom Jones beating his wife again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, go ahead, go ahead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We interrupt this program to bring you a special announcement. This afternoon, the body of Richard Hale, father of the girl who died in the automobile accident involving the governor's son, was found. A medical examination revealed he was beaten to death.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The ugly charge of "official murder" has been hurled at the administration by a coalition of Stark's opponents, led by Judge Stanton, lately an outspoken critic of the administration.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Jack) Your friend, the Judge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thus an almost forgotten incident provided the spark that might set off the explosion needed to rock Willie Stark out of power. The latest report is that impeachment proceedings may be instituted...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How long will it take you to pack? I want you to go back to Capital City with me tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because I need you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (still speaking to Lucy) I'll explain all of that later. Now, Lucy, do like I say.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll wait outside.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You stay right here, Jack. I want you bear witness to what I've got to say.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (indicating Sadie) She can be a witness too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (starting toward the door) I'm going back to the capital and get hold of Duffy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You stay right here, Sadie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Somebody's got to go back to the capital. I'll go in the other car.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, then tell Duffy not to do anything or say anything until I get there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, Governor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now he needs us. Now that he's in trouble he needs us, so he can lead us around like monkeys with rings in our noses. So he can say to people, look at me, feel sorry for me... just a family man with a wife and a crippled son...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shouts) Shut up!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Willie!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why don't you leave us alone?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Leave him alone. How many scrapes have I gotten him out of? How many girls?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Willie, stop.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not him they're after. It's me. How many halfwitted apes do you think I'm going to have to pay to square this one? What do you think this is going to cost me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you think it cost him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in a broken voice) A man builds for his son. That's all he builds for.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Willie! (turns and goes into Tom's room) Tom... Tom.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Give me a drink, Jack.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She'll go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No good, Willie. No good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Speaker, I offer a house resolution. Whereas Willie Stark, governor of this state, has been guilty of incompetence, corruption, and favoritism in office -- yes, and other high crimes -- that he is hereby impeached, and ordered to be tried by the senate.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (as he meets Duffy) What's the score?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're lined up against you solid. They had a meeting.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How do you know? Were you there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Me? What would I be doing there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Selling me out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How many votes have we got?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (going through some files) Eleven.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We need twenty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We might be able to dig up a few more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. Do you know how?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Jack. Come here. What have you got in your black book about that old friend of yours?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who do you mean?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know who I'm talking about... your old friend, the Judge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If and when you need it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If and when? I need it right now. He's got four senators wrapped up in his hip pocket. Come on, come on, boy... what have you got?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm going to give him a break. If he can prove it isn't true, I won't spill it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I ought to bust you, Jack.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I promised two people I'd do it this way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who are they?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Myself... and someone else. It doesn't matter who. I'm going to give him a break.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, give him a break. But if you got the facts, you got the facts. The truth is sufficient... just like it says in the Bible.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's the way it's going to be.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, boy... I'll trust you. Where are you going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (on his way out) I'll be around.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who else do you think he promised, Willie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You'd be smart... play square with him. You're going to need people like us around.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (as he shuts his door) Are you sure?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : THE IMPEACHMENT Willie's car speeding down a road. Willie, with Lucy and Tom seated behind him, addressing crowd. Willie speaking from the back of a train to a railroad station audience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Close-ups of Willie, speaking to the people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sign on back of a car: FIGHT WITH WILLIE Crowds carrying signs: WIN WITH WILLIE Willie talking on the telephone. Sadie listens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More men with WIN WITH WILLIE signs. Man directing crowd from top of bus. Other bus loads of people are seen, all of them bearing signs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crowd looks on as two uniformed police drag a man away. Willie's car waiting. Two thugs talk things over with a man on his doorstep. Willie discussing matters with a man in his office. Two cops stand with him. Willie and Jack in the car. Sugar Boy drives. It is night. Sugar Boy drives fast, and has to swerve to avoid colliding with a truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack and Sugar wait in the car as Willie leans out the car window to talk to a senator. He offers the man a piece of paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Exterior: Highway, Night Willie's car, as it races down the highway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exterior: Ferry to Burden's Landing, Night Willie's car coming across on the ferry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Exterior: Stanton Home, Night As Willie's car stops and they all get out.

direction.raw_text: Jack goes into the house alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Interior: Judge Stanton's Study, Night Jack and the Judge are seated opposite each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door opens and Willie and Sugar Boy enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Willie takes a seat in an easy chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Willie picks up a decanter off the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack and Judge Stanton remain standing, silently watching Willie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Judge shakes his head. He doesn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Judge examines the papers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The front door opens, and Adam and Anne come in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A shot is fired. They turn and rush into the Judge's study. They find the Judge face downward in his leather chair. Adam and Jack kneel beside him. Willie, holding on tightly to Anne's arm, stands in the doorway. Jack picks up the Judge's pistol and looks at Adam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Exterior: Stanton Home, Night Jack comes out of the house, followed by Anne and Adam.

direction.raw_text: Adam looks unbelievingly at Anne. She looks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through Jack's window we see the street blocked with cars and people, all headed for the State Capitol Building. Anne is in the crowd, trying to get across the street. Seeing Jack in the window, she pushes her way across and enters the hotel. He slams the window shut and comes back into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack turns it off. He goes over to his bed and starts putting clothes into a valise. There is a knock on the door. He ignores it. Another knock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anne enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She starts to cry. He grabs her, pulling her face close to his.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He lets her go and she falls to the bed, sobbing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes up his coat.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (voice over) The chips were down, and Willie knew it. He was fighting for his life. He roared across the state making one speech after another. And all of them added up to the same thing... "It's not me they're after, it's you!"
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (voice over) Willie hollered foul. Willie knew if you hollered long enough, hard enough, and loud enough, people begin to believe you. Just in case they didn't, he organized spontaneous demonstrations.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell the boys to get the hicks out. Bring 'em in from the sticks, empty the pool halls. Turn 'em out. Turn the yokels out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (voice over) In case anyone hollered back, he organized spontaneous slugging. Willie pulled every trick he ever knew -- and added a few more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Sugar! (To Willie) You'll never live to be impeached!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Boy, I'll live to be President...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've got fourteen senators to vote against impeachment. If I win, you're out of politics.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (refuses to sign) I'll do whatever the Judge says.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (voice over) And always the trail led to one place... Burden's Landing... and the Judge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You sure you don't want me to go in with you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, hurry it up, boy. We've got places to go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Judge, I beg you, as a favor to yourself, to me... call up, release your votes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I made a mistake once, Jack... when I resigned. It was too easy then, just resigning, pulling out. No, Jack, I've made my choice. I have nothing more to lose.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Judge, you know what Stark is capable of. Think it over. I'll leave now. I'll come back tomorrow and we'll talk about it again. You can give me your answer then.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't wait until tomorrow. I'm a very impatient man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rising) I told you not to come in here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (ignoring him) Is it true, Judge, that you're behind the impeachment proceedings?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, it's true.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wanted to hear you say it with your own silver tongue.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, you've heard it. If that's all you came to hear you could have saved yourself a trip.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mind if I pour myself a drink? How about you, Judge, will you have one? You better... You're going to need it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What'd he say, Jack?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You'll get your answer tomorrow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you kidding? Did you show it to him, or didn't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Show me what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what I figured. Let's get down to cases, Judge. Do you remember a man with the name of Littlepaugh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Remember the Fortune Electric Company?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course. I was their counsel for over ten years.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Remember how you got the job?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How did you find out?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hands the Judge some papers) Do you remember how you got the job?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, Judge, dirt's a funny thing. Some of it rubs off on everybody. How did you get the job, Judge? Blackmail?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Jack) I swear I never even remembered his name. Isn't that remarkable, Jack? I never even remembered his name. It's all so long ago it's hard for me to realize it ever happened.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. But it did.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, it did. But it's difficult for me to realize it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For me too, Judge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks for that much.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I guess you know what the next move is, don't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, I do. Jack Burden. Willie Stark's hatchet man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Willie) I asked you... how did you find out?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This would never stand at law, not for a minute. It happened over twenty- five years ago, and you could never get any testimony. Everybody is dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Everybody except you, Judge. You're alive. And people think you're a certain kind of man. And you just couldn't bear for people to think otherwise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ever since then I... I've done my duty. I... I'm responsible for many good things. (looks at the papers again) But I also did this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, yes, you did.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Judge, I beg of you, call and release your votes, for your sake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have tender sensibilities for a hatchet man. (goes to the door) Good night, gentlemen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How about my answer?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You'll have it in the morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I want it tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In the morning. Good night, gentlemen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How did you find out?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We've got a lot to do. It's getting late, Jack. Let's get back to town.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know we're through, don't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aw, you don't mean that, boy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's all right, doc. Just here to discuss some politics with the Judge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, I see. (starts upstairs) Well, good night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Anne) Did you give him -- WILLIE Wait a minute, Jack -- JACK Answer me. Did you give --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aren't you going back with him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why not? You belong with him. Jack, how could you have done it? When Anne brought me those papers she told me you promised not to tell Stark until...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. I know. (walks away) Well, I kept my promise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anne? Anne?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: From all over the state they're streaming in. From the hill country and farms, the lumber camps... by boat, by train, by horse, and on foot. Willie Stark's army.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The state capital is filled with rumors, one of which is that Stark is planning to seize power by force. As commander of the state militia, he has --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come in. The door's open.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jack...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you want?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (bitterly) No, I want to see you cry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stop it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I called you. All afternoon I've been calling you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know. I was here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You've got to tell Adam. You've got to see him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell him what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He knows about me and...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: About you and Willie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nods) I tried to explain to him. I... I tried to explain to him that it wasn't the way he thought it was.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How was it, Anne? You tell me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He hit me, Jack. My own brother... he hit me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your brother is an old-fashioned man. He believes in his sister's honor. Me, I'm a modern man. (slams clothes into the valise) The twentieth-century type. I run.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rises) I'm frightened, Jack.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For who? Your brother, or Willie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) We're through.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who's through with who?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He called me this afternoon. He's going back to Lucy. He said it was better that way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Better for who? Him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Both of us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did he tell you that too when he asked you to betray the Judge? At least I walked out on him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh Jack... help me, please, please. Adam's all I've got left now. Oh, Jack, if you ever loved me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If I ever loved you. (pause) I'll go find Adam.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: HERE ON THIS SITE WILL BE ERECTED THE GOVERNOR STARK HOSPITAL -- TO HEAL SICKNESS -- TO EASE PAIN -- FREE
NOT AS A CHARITY BUT AS A RIGHT

direction.raw_text: : HOSPITAL SITE, DAY A large billboard. It reads HERE ON THIS SITE WILL BE ERECTED THE GOVERNOR STARK HOSPITAL -- TO HEAL SICKNESS -- TO EASE PAIN -- FREE. NOT AS A CHARITY BUT AS A RIGHT. WILLIE STARK Adam enters, looks at the sign, and walks on. Exterior: Street Near Capitol Building, Day Crowds of people headed toward the building, some with WIN WITH WILLIE signs. A marching band plays music for them. Exterior: Capitol Building, Day Crowd waiting outside the building. Mounted policemen keep them in line. From a large platform, loaded with people, comes the chant "We want Willie, we want Willie." Jack pushes his way through the people and speaks to a policeman standing guard on the Capitol steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack turns and looks at the large crowd. A voice from a public address loudspeaker begins to yell out commands to the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The chant is picked up enthusiastically by the crowd. Interior: State Legislature, Day The speaker is trying to speak over the clamor of the chanting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Willie gets up, and goes to the window. Exterior: State Capitol, Day The crowd, with Jack in the foreground. The crowd suddenly goes wild as they see Willie appear at the window. In the growing darkness he seems only a shadowy figure as he raises his hands to wave to the crowd. We see various shots of people straining to get a little closer to the steps in order to see him better. Willie then turns and goes back into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Exterior: State Capitol, Day The crowd again, still waiting. The camera pans upward to a loudspeaker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The camera moves over the faces of the people listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They cheer. Camera picks up Jack watching the crowd's reaction, then up to a plaque over the entrance to the Capitol Building. It reads THE PEOPLE'S WILL IS THE LAW OF THIS STATE -- GOVERNOR STARK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Exterior: State Capitol, Night Newsmen, photographers stand about, bored. The crowd, every bit as large, is quiet but expectant. Everyone holds still as the announcer's voice is heard again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crowd explodes. People break through the police barriers. Mounted policemen ride in quickly to prevent a riot. Camera picks up Anne in the crowd, trying to push through. Jack stands on the steps of the Capitol, watching it all. Suddenly Willie appears at the top of the steps, followed by Sugar Boy. Sadie, Duffy, Pillsbury follow close behind. Willie grabs hold of the mike and addresses the suddenly hushed crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Loud applause, and cries of "yes."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Having finished, he waves at them all. Then he notices Jack and comes down the steps to greet him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He walks back up the steps, his arm around Jack's shoulders. They start to go into the building that way when Willie sees someone. He smiles and puts out his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam is seen, waiting at the entrance of the building. Before Willie has taken a step Adam fires several shots into him. Willie falls to the ground and Sugar Boy whips out his pistol and fires at Adam. Three policemen with tommy guns open fire, shooting into Adam's already fallen body. Then they turn and point their guns at the mob of people rushing toward Willie, forcing them back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sugar Boy kneels beside Willie. Sadie stands against a pillar, looking down on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack looks up to see Anne struggling through the screaming mob to get to Adam. She looks at Adam for a moment, then turns away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She doesn't answer, only walks away. He runs after her and catches hold of her arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns her around so that she can see the crowds still struggling to get a look at Willie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A policeman approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No reply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She nods her head slowly. Jack walks through the building to the pillar against which Willie has been propped. Sugar Boy is still beside him. He stands behind Sadie and Duffy, looking down at Willie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His head droops to the side and he dies.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where do you think you're going? (recognizes Jack) Oh, I'm sorry. I didn't recognize you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you know who Dr. Stanton is?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did he try to come through here today?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Haven't seen him, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, can you check the other entrances?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's no other entrances today. The other entrances are blocked off. Orders are to take no chances.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you care to come inside and wait, Mr. Burden, we can find you a seat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, thanks. I'll wait out here. If Dr. Stanton shows up, let me know. Pass the word along to the boys, will you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right now. Everybody... that means everybody... let's let Willie know we're here! All together: WE WANT WILLIE. WE WANT WILLIE.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We will first proceed to take the judgment of the senate on the question of the impeachment of the governor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rising) Mr. Speaker, this is a farce to ask us to vote in the face of the kind of intimidation and pressure that has been exerted here in the past few weeks. Even that crowd outside, yelling on cue, is part of that pressure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We want Willie. We want Willie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Attention, please. Attention, please. This is a special announcement from Willie Stark to you people out there. He doesn't want any one of you to leave...
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: THE PEOPLE'S WILL IS THE LAW OF THIS STATE -- GOVERNOR STARK

dialogue.raw_text: He wants you to stay in front of this state Capitol until the fight is over. If you want Willie Stark to win, stay where you are.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you hear me... stay where you are. Don't go away. Stay where you are. Don't go away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Attention, please. Attention, please. The balloting on the impeachment proceedings against Governor Stark has just ended. This is the result: Willie Stark has won.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They tried to ruin me. But they are ruined. They tried to ruin me because they did not like what I have done. Do you like what I have done?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Remember, it's not I who have won, but you. Your will is my strength, and your need is my justice, and I shall live in your right and your will. And if any man tries to stop me from fulfilling that right and that will, I'll break him. I'll break him with my bare hands. For I have the strength of many.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello, Jack boy, I'm glad you're here. I knew you'd come back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, doctor, I'm very glad to see you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stand back, everybody. Stand back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nearly crying) D-does it hurt m-much, boss? D-d- does it hurt much?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anne, Anne... Where are you going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know. Leave me alone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To do what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't care.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, that's too easy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know, I don't know, I don't know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Leave me alone, please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, no more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're alive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My brother's dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We've got to go on living.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So that Adam's death has meaning, so that it wasn't wasted. Anne, our life has to give his death meaning. Don't you see that? Look at those people...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look at them! They still believe in him. And we've got to make them see Willie the way Adam saw him, or there's no meaning in anything... anything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Burden... the governor's asking for you. You better hurry. He's going fast.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Anne) Will you wait here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Will you wait here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It could have been the whole world, Willie Stark. The whole world... Willie Stark. Why did he do it to me... Willie Stark? Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue
